page.title: 04DAIRYING IN RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: Most of the farms in the Ramsbottom area are{dairy farms}which provide local people with their milk and dairy products. A girl in our form lives on such a farm. "We get up at 5 o'clock each day and go out on two{milk rounds.}We have 44 cows which we milk twice a day- at 8 a.m. and 4 p.m. We have to bottle the milk, wash the milking parlour and clean the dirty bottles. After milking the cows are put in the fields. We also have geese, ducks, sheep and dogs. We go to bed early because of our early rise. We milk by machine. Most of the work on the farm is done by the family itself. We buy our cattle at the local{cattle market}at Haslingden."
